articles.author: CBC News
articles.title: Is Italy ready for cricket-powder pizza? | CBC News
articles.description: Italy greenlit the sale of insect products late last year, but included strict regulations on supermarket placement and labelling. One chef is already using cricket powder in his pizza.
articles.content: At the seafront pizzeria La Rambla in Maccarese, Italy, a short drive from Rome, chef Carlo Del Buono stood at the kitchen counter, throwing a few fistfuls of cricket powder into a bowl of pizza doug… [+4339 chars]

articles.author: David Mark, Basel Hindeleh, Jonathan Hepburn
articles.title: Inside the science of what makes a cricket ball swing
articles.description: It is one of the most devastating weapons a fast bowler can own — but the art of swing is steeped in mystery and myths that only science can explain.
articles.content:
Pat Cummins is steaming in at the SCG to Pakistan's star batter, Babar Azam.
He lets a ball rip that out of the hand is heading outside the off-stump, before it swerves dramatically in to trap Azam … [+19477 chars]

articles.title: PCB hands Umar Akmal three-year ban from all cricket | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.description: Penalty after the batsman pleaded guilty to not reporting corrupt approaches | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.content: Umar Akmal's troubled cricket career has hit its biggest roadblock yet, with the PCB handing him a ban from all representative cricket for three years after he pleaded guilty of failing to report det… [+1506 chars]

articles.title: What we learned from watching the 1992 World Cup final in full again | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.description: Wides, lbw calls, swing - plenty of things were different in white-ball cricket back then | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.content: Last week, we at ESPNcricinfo did something we have been thinking of doing for eight years now: pretend-live ball-by-ball commentary for a classic cricket match. We knew the result, yes, but we tried… [+6823 chars]
